channel.title: Sound Card
channel.description:
I'll be upgrading in about 4 months, and I want to get a DECENT sound card which allows me to record properly. I want to be able to have two applications (one using asio, one using directsound) output sound without a problem. Right now I'm using an onboard one, and I can't mix two channels into one channel with it, which is a pain in the ass.
What's a recommendable card for this? Not too expensive please..

item.title: Sound Card
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:10, topic:290934”]What you need is an audio interface. Assuming you’re using a board with an XLR output, I recommend this one if you don’t wanna pay a fuckton:

http://www.guitarcenter.com/MXL-Mic-Mate-XLR-to-USB-Mic-Interface-with-Phantom-Power-104615877-i1326025.gc[/quote]
I got the audio interface (USB Output from my pod, connecting it to asio), but my sound card is crap and basically, if i use anything that can play sound (yes, even windows itself), it’ll refuse to output ableton’s audio to my speakers, that’s why i need a decent sound card.

Read full topic

What you need is an audio interface. Assuming you’re using a board with an XLR output, I recommend this one if you don’t wanna pay a fuckton:

item.title: Sound Card
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

T4_:

Creative Audigy wasn’t too bad; and, iirc X-Fi series are pretty high-quality (not studio-worthy of course).

X-Fi drivers suck major ass. prepare to waste almost all of your ram using windows 7 + x-fi (don’t worry, the linux driver is poo too)

Read full topic

i think100-200 euros, something like that.

item.title: Sound Card
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

how much you looking at spending

it should be pointed out that mixing two channels into one is done by a mixer, hence the name, not a sound card

Read full topic

item.title: Sound Card
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

Mopman:

i wouldnt buy a home cinema/htpc card if you want to record anything. buy a prosumer level card.

And what kinda cards should i be looking at?

Read full topic
